After waiting outside for 30-35 minutes then being seated on one of the many empty patio tables... we sit down and look over the menu, 20 minutes later we still haven't seen a server for drinks or anything for the matter. After another 10 minutes we tried to get a servers attention just to get some ice water (it's 95 degrees and sitting outside) no one paid any attention to us at all. So... we ended up leaving. I did notice when we walked out to leave a few servers standing talking to each other, yet no one said one word to us... the entire place is giant windows.... I work in the food service industry myself and understand a rush but to be completely ignored after being there an hour? I don't think that's cool..... I don't think we will be going back anytime soon and that sucks because the food the first time was great. Maybe it was a bad day but you can't ignore people like that. We were there for an hour total and got nothing but to look at the pretty pastry case. #SadMoments

Love, love, love this place!!!! The food is so creative and tastes amazing!!! Service is decent. They get busy during lunch hour and so can get a little hectic. Totally worth the trip to enjoy this place!!

Been here a few times and the food was good. Tried the avocado toast,  chicken and What?, Korean tacos and salmon benny.  All were good and the presentation was nice. It's definitely a trendy little spot .  The service is okay which is why I gave it a 4.  The waitress at our last visit kept forgetting our requests and we had to bother a different server. But overall it's a cool place to go for brunch.

My husband and I decided to share the short rib hash with an over-easy egg on top since it was the first time we were trying this place. Also had the truffle fries. Both were incredibly delicious!! Glad we decided to try it. Would definitely come back.
When was the last time your server remembered you from your last visit??  Great service, awesome food, nice atmosphere. New fave breakfast place!

Checked out this place for lunch on a Tuesday as per a recommendation. Immediately fell in love with the ambiance- from their succulent wall to their cute little 2-person booths!   The staff greeted us immediately and were friendly and prompt with seating us. The place was busy! Always a good sign that our meal is going to be good.   They're only open for breakfast and lunch but serve breakfast all day (until they close at 3PM)- dare I say..this may be my new brunch spot!?   They have vegan and gluten free items and healthy/guilty pleasure items- something for everyone! They also make their pastries in house daily and serve espresso and fresh juices.   I tried the fried avocado tacos (Vegan) and it came with 3 and was a perfect little lunch! I'm giving it 4 stars because the service was just okay- we had to ask for water after our meal as we never got any. My coffee was also so-so but they did fix it for me when I asked them to.

Just so this is recorded in the internet as well as a note on the website, I want you to know the behavior of our waiter was terrible, I gave me ice cold syrup on my half eaten, warm hot cakes and thin acted like it was code to keep syrup cold when I brought it to his attention. Not a single apology, arrogance and disrespect is our memory of our experience at your restaurant. It's my lady's Birthday, she always wanted to try your restaurant and our experience was fine till we needed something from our server. Then his response was an excuse not an apology. This is really a bad experience.

After enjoying pastries from CraftKitchen on our last trip, we decided to have a sit down breakfast this morning with each of us choosing avocado toast.   A massive amount of avocado on a grilled toast, sunflower pesto and a single poached egg proved to be delicious, but hardly worth the sticker price.

My boyfriend and I stop in from time to time. The staff is always so friendly and accommodating. We have never had a bad meal here. This is the kind of place where your face will be remembered and it will you leave feeling satisfied. It's obvious that the owners pride themselves on good service and excellent cuisine.

What a beautiful experience!  When you first walk in, it feels like a modern country chic kitchen. It's bright and white with natural colors and tones. It's quaint and pretty! The plates are even pretty!  But the food... Wow, the food!! We started with the homemade, flaky, buttery berry poptart. It had the perfect amount of filling and our server was excellent when she offered to warm it up for us! Took me right back to my childhood.  We then moved on to the protein plate and chorizo and eggs- both were fantastic! Everything was wonderful and I am excited to try it out again. Brunch anyone?

Eclectic menu with prices about 30% higher than comparable restaurants in the area. Lunch with dessert and tip for two people just short of $50.00 (no alcohol). Lunch entrees were tasty; pastries were attractive, but not very good.
One of the best brunch off the strip!!! Paul was our waiter he was awesome!!!! Good for kids and adults!

It was worth the 20 minute wait. The food is cooked wonderfully well and service was excellent. We sat outside as the line was long and they have no seats to sit and wait. I ordered the roast beef sandwich and it came out the way I asked, cut in 3 so I can share. The sandwich is shaped like a slider and I was expecting a hoagie. The meat was tender and flavorful. The rest of the parties shrimp and grits and portabello mushroom sliders were tasty as well. Food items are made differently here but everything is cooked well. No complaints. Service was snappy even though we sat outside. I joked that he can bring me a knife if the kitchen forgot to slice my sandwich and he didn't forget. The mimosas were tasty with fresh squeezed pomegranate juice.
Great service! Healthy options for breakfast. Nice change from usual, heavy Vegas fare.
Good quality. Clean. Fresh squeezed OJ, great coffee, and right up the street from me. Fav.

Its a good breakfast place. Its not crowded and food is good. They serve pretty decent amount of food in reasonable price. Locals are very lucky for having great restaurants  around aside from being in the strip.

Went to Craft Kitchen today 11/6 just me and 4 lady friends Josh the waiter took good care of us. Five Bloody Marys and five omelets later we were relaxed and having a marvellous time. So I say, CK for good food, great omelets and a good time with  ladies friends. Thanks, Craft Kitchen

Ordered the: -immune boost juice ( they took it to the wrong table and arrived at the end of the meal, but they were nice enough to take it off) juice was poppin -chicken and waffles: they do a jalapeno twist on it and while it was good the waffles were just adequate. -chorizo skillet: this was the star very good portion. Super tasty, loved all the potatoes in it. Really good. -seasonal pop tart: not too sweet which i approve of and really liked it.  Price wise was as expected we spent about $35 for the above. Not including the juice that was about $9.  Love the decor and ambiance the place has. Staff was really friendly and helpful.

I was a little worried when my grits came out with greenery in them but boy, was I pleasantly surprised! I got the CK Special with a side of Cheesy Grits. Everything was DELICIOUS. I went alone so I sat at a little table near the center of the restaurant - Awesome atmosphere and amazing wait staff. My only complaint would be the comfort of the chairs. I'm a little hippy and the chair rails dug into my hips. Next time, I'll request a booth. Lol.

Rarely have I been to a place where the food looks as good in person as it does in pictures. I had the roasted salmon benedict. It was pretty good except the English muffin was mush three bites in and I hadn't even poured the hollandaise on. Also salmon could have been cooked a little less for a better texture. I absolutely will be back for some of the other things I wanted to try. That mocha though, now I can never go back to Starbucks.

This place is a gem !! I can remember when my daughter and I first went we fell in love right away with the pretzel bun used for the salmon and baked capers super tasty ... every time we go we still get the lox on the pretzel we each get a half then we try something new along with it today that was the breakfast egg and bacon  croissant sandwich it came with a tasty salad as well.

The food is amazing I'm so glad my wife found this place excellent for lunch I had to pause during my meal to write this. The parking is very accessible the dining areas is amazingly clean , the walls are covered with painting that bring a lot of life to the restaurant. I love the aged wooden tables that are branded with the restaurant name "craft kitchen" even more the bathrooms the floor the walls the chairs everything is so so clean. Everything is made fresh , and they offer vegan plant based meals. Everything is organic they bake they're own pastries an breads here which is a huge plus. I ordered the scrambled eggs with chorizo over sliced potatoes with a side of avocado and let me tell you it is amazing so much flavor you have to try it  believe me you won't be disappointed.

Went here for the second time today and ohhh my goodness.. it did not disappoint. The carnitas omelet is delicious and if you like breakfast with salsa and a kick in it. Definitely get that. They also have this salsa who they say is spicy but it's really do able. Today I decided to get their special, pork belly breakfast tacos! It comes with 3 and surprisingly, there wasn't much fat at all on the pork belly! Definitely put some salsa on that. I love my breakfast with a kick in it so I tend to choose ones that go well with pico de Gallo or salsa. I couldn't leave without getting fries so I got the truffle fries! If you like skinny crunchy fries, you'll love the fries here. Since I can never make up my mind, I also went for the carnitas eggs Benedict. It wasn't my favorite dish I've had from here, BUT let's talk about that poached egg doe!! Perrrrrfectly ooey gooey yolk BURSTING out when you cut into it. When you lightly poke at it, it wiggles.... Now that's perfection. For first timers I definitely recommend the carnitas omelet and fries!

My favorite brunch place!!! I live in Summerlin and I dont mind the drive. Great atmosphere and customer service!   I've tried their shrimp and grits and the short rib beef hash and they are both amazing!   Dont miss out on dessert! They have THE best BREAD PUDDING in my life! Their espresso drinks are also great to pair with the pudding.   I had a sticky bun to go and it is a MUST try!

Loved it! Clean, cute, nice outdoor seating. My friend is Gluten-Free and Lactose Intolerant and it was very easy to accommodate her! Always a plus! The food was unique and delicious. We all enjoyed our meals. The coffee is fresh pressed as well!

Their presentation is great. The food itself was okay. For the price we paid I def felt like it have been better. I got one of the breakfast sandwich and it was pretty basic. Nothing spectacular about it at all. I got one of their bloody Mary's and they used sake instead of regular liquor? It gave it an odd taste and again it was just over priced and didn't enjoy it. Everything is pretty over done or has some "cool" twist on it. My bf and I even joked about their red velvet pancake, about asking for a regular one, and being told they don't do "basic" pancakes....we asked, they didn't have regular pancakes, just the red velvet.

The breakfast burrito was very greasy and NOT flavorful. Just a bunch of bland things mixed together.  I had to ask for hot sauce and smother it because the green sauce that comes with the burrito was also bland and I felt like I was just eating mayo. It was bad.  The atmosphere is nice and pretty and cute.  The Pork omelet was okay, tasteful and aesthetically pleasing. The pork was dry.  The monkey bread was SUPER hard on top but oh so gooey in the middle. Very sweet.  Service was Incredibly slow.

Finally got a chance to come by today with a bunch of friends.   Ambiance:  This place is very cozy and nicely decorated and offers both indoor and patio seating. Both dining spaces are inviting and I'm a fan of their use of decorations of succulents, grass, herbs, and wood top tables...it gives this place a farm to table vibe! Which is what they aspire to do.   Food:  I personally ordered the Pulled Turkey Benny which was delicious. Turkey was moist and seasoned nicely, perfectly poached eggs, and the hollandaise sauce served on the side was honestly the best I ever had, with heavenly notes of lemon but still very balanced...gonna have to try to imitate that recipe!  Also had the house made gravlax...the fried capers were such a nice touch! It was tasty. We also got to try the hummus and focaccia, which was really good too!   All my friends ordered various items on the menu and no one was disappointed. 3 of us got their coffee and one friend ordered their bottomless mimosa, which tasted great. We had one kid with us and she loved her waffles!!!  Very kid friendly place. All of us will be back.

Very nice staff. I got the turkey Benedict for Saturday brunch was quite disappointed. I love eggs bene of all sorts. This was supposed to have avocado, instead had that subway mashed up quac type spread. No actual avo. Also very bland and had no flavor. So I basically just ate the turkey and runny egg. Disappointing.
Food is good. However not worth 45 min wait. So many empty tables and still have to wait. Service was ok. Last time we will be coming here.

I've ate here a few times because it's close to work. Today I had the pulled turkey benny, it comes with a citrus sauce which was okay. I think without the citrus flavor it would have been so much better. The staff are all pretty nice & friendly. Their coffee is good! I think they're kind of pricey here because their food isn't anything to die for. I don't ever crave anything from here and it's never a place I choose to eat at. I just end up coming here because my boss chooses it since it's convenient because of the location.

I love that Vegas is starting to get more and more local places to eat. It's a great option over going to a casino or to the strip.   I thought this place was so cute! I came here recently with my uncle for breakfast. I love that they use local ingredients and are a farm to table restaurant.   They have outside seating but since it was winter it was too cold to sit here. We arrived just in time before a large crowd came in so we were able to get a table relatively quickly. If you do not feel like waiting a long time for a table on the weekend I would suggest getting there at 11am or before. This place gets popular after that!  I decided to order the avocado toast. This comes with an egg on the top and pesto. I really enjoyed this and felt proud for eating healthy since the other things I tried weren't as healthy.   We also tried their pecan sticky bun. It was so good! I wish we would have had them warm it up, I bet that would have tasted amazing.   I also ordered their hot chocolate that came with a marshmallow that was dipped in chocolate and peppermint. It was so rich I had to add a little water to it but it was very good. Dipping in the marshmallow was my favorite part and was glad it was included with the drink.  Lastly, we took a cupcake home with us. Since it was Christmas time it was a red velvet cupcake with frosting that was made to look like a reindeer. It was so cute and part of the reason why I purchased it. I really enjoyed it and was a good take home treat.   The prices here are a little higher since they are dealing with local ingredients but I do not mind paying extra for quality food.    I would love to try their lunch here next time!

I really want to like this place but I ALWAYS leave hungry and out about $50.   The freshness, light flavor, close proximity to home is there but they always lack service and portion, I guess. The servers are nice but some thing is just missing.

I loved this place!!! It was quite a drive for me since I live in northwest Las Vegas, but oh so worth the trip. We went during prime time, brunch on a Saturday, so the wait time was around 10 minutes which wasn't bad at all. The menu had a lot to choose from and was very affordable (ranging from $10-12); all the food, and even the coffee, tasted wonderful; service was great and fast; bakery items were also cheap and delicious. Overall I highly recommend this place since there aren't too many classy yet fairly priced breakfast/brunch places out here.

I have been wanting to come here for a longest time since  many of my friends like this place. Unfortunately, I was not satisfied with the service nor the food.   The service was soooo slow. There were two tables behind us that were seated after us and were able to order before us. Not to mention they got their food at least 20 minutes before we did. I was not happy about that. Then, we waited about forty minutes to get our food.  They couldn't even give us our appetizer first. I mean forty minutes come on. Fries is the easier thing you can prepare in the kitchen. The waitress was nice enough to bring us one banana chocolate bread (there was four of us) but she didn't even follow up with us on our order till we complained to her about the wait. She barely even had time to come by to refill my water.   I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffles were decent but the chicken was not crispy but rather soggy. Very disappointed. I tried my friends short rib hash which was pretty flavorful.   In short, a highly disappointing brunch experience. I will give their dinner another try since my friend strongly recommended it.

CRAFTkitchen was great for a late Saturday brunch!  My party and Iarrived around 1:45 and the restaurant was busy but not too busy... we were seated right away.  The service was great, our waiter was very prompt and polite. He also seemed to have great timing. As I had friends visiting from out of town so we were very busy conversing most of the time. He always came around at the perfect time for ordering as well as refills and extras.  I ordered the carnitas omelette and it was DELICIOUS! The pork was tender and flavorful and mixed with the green salsa and cheese it was perfect. The portion was great as well... it wasn't to much food, I was able to eat most of it and share with my friends. I left feeling full, but not stuffed and that made me very happy. I also tried a bit of my friends meals: the apple cobbler pancakes and the breakfast burrito. First off all of the dishes were perfect portions and were presented beautifully. They cut the breakfast burrito in half making it easy to take the other half home. It was still delicious reheated later that day. I really liked the idea of putting a chili relleno in the burrito. It was different then your typical "breakfast burrito". The  salsa verde (served w burrito) was the same that was served on my omelette and it was really delicious and simple.  Now the apple cobbler pancakes were FANTASTIC! I will be back to try those again! The pancakes held up great to the warm flavorful syrupy apple cobbler and had a bit of texture with the crunchy topping.  For drinks we ordered michaladas and pomegranate mimosas. Both were delicious and served in beautiful glassware. (Making for great social media pics)  I can't wait to go back to CRAFTkitchen and try more of what they offer on the menu. The pastries in the pastry case looked delicious ( wanted to try them but was pleasantly full after our meal) I would love to try the coffee as well. They have so much to offer, and makes me eager to be back for more.
The best service I've ever had. They were so friendly. And I even lost my phone in the restaurant and Devin helped me find it. Thanks again for everything!

Very modern decor and eye appealing, but food doesn't deliver. Smashed potatoes are a great idea, but they needed salt. The turkey sausage was god awful. The grits were in the same boat as the turkey sausage, just horrible and made by someone who has no idea how to make grits. Overall the food lacked flavor and technique. If you want a great breakfast go to Mesa Grill at Caesars Palace and let Bobby show you how grits are made. This is a great example of how easy people are fooled with fancy decor and cool plate presentations. Open your eyes people and let the food be the deciding factor. I don't see this place around for long.

I love the atmosphere here. It's a pretty restaurant. Very trendy. Great place for breakfast/brunch. I got the pork carnitas omelet. Yummy! This was one of the few times I finished my whole plate! Great portion size for me. My boyfriend got the C.K. special with bacon and turkey sausage. He also finished his entire plate. He said the turkey sausage was amazing!
Awesome Place! Great food.  A little expensive to go all the time, but you get what you pay for! Me and my family and friends will all be back!
What a great little gem in Henderson. Love the atmosphere and the unique menu...Love this place.

Excellent customer service!! I was actually surprised the service was so wonderful. This is the type of service you would expect at a high end restaurant. The staff makes you feel welcome and always remembers you. The dishes are all delicious and inventive. I have dined here at least 4 times in the last few months, truly enjoyable experience. This is a must try!

This is a MUCH delayed review as I have eaten at this establishment multiple times.  I think I leave with my stomach so full and I'm just so happy that I forget all about writing a review. My deepest apologies. I have enjoyed amazing breakfast during the week and the phenomenal ever-changing brunch on the weekend, as well.  The meals are always prepared to order and with the freshest ingredients possible.  I'll go on record as saying that my favorite breakfast at CRAFTkitchen is the Smashed Avocado Toast. For someone who has a sweet tooth this just blows my mind with the fresh greens. My poached egg was cooked exactly the way I like it, as well.   When my friends and I returned (on another date -- to celebrate my birthday) we decided to try out the brunch and we were pleasantly surprised with the vast menu options. We all tried something different and shared the CK Monkey Bread. Soooo yummy! Pretty sure we were rolled out of there that day. ;) The coffee is always fresh and delicious (which I, personally LOVE!) and the servers are extremely attentive.  CRAFTkitchen is by far one of my fave local places to eat. I'll continue to recommend it to anyone and everyone. Keep up the GREAT work!!

Cozy atmosphere, grass-fed food, and bottomless mimosas.  Our server Elle was outstanding, and catered to all of our needs.  She explained multiple items in great detail and made sure we were taken care of.  All of us preferred different items, the butternut squash hash, protein breakfast, and chorizo omelet.  All three of us were truly satisfied with our orders  First the butternut squash hash was outstanding topped with shredded turkey.  For the table we ordered some sweet potato fries that were amazing as well.  My friend ordered the chorizo omelet with bacon and literally could not stop talking about it.  The melding of cheese egg and bacon truly made the meal for him.  As far as atmosphere, the tables are close together, but far enough to have individual conversations.  Realistically this place always has a wait, and tries their best to accommodate as many patrons as possible.  My best advice is to order the bottomless mimosas.  At $8 a glass and $16 bottomless, it makes absolute sense to go all the way.  Be sure to try all the options, blood orange, regular, and pomegranate.  Last but not least, be sure to try the banana nut bread.  My friend ordered it as a starter and we had to order another!  Between the food, the ambiance, service, and overall presentation, this place is definitely a 5/5.

First time trying this place, at the request of my husband. I like fresh, homegrown, organic ingredients, and he used that to get me to go! I also like supporting local small business.   The place was packed! We got the last empty table inside of the restaurant. That told me that this place was going to be good. The decor is super cute, and the bathroom is clean. Love all of the plants everywhere, including the herb garden outside.   Server came right over after we sat down with water. I didn't catch his name, but he had a long black point tail. He was really good! As it was our first time here, we had to read the entire menu over, and the server was kind enough to give us a couple of minutes several times to decide what we wanted.   My little one ordered hot chocolate, which she loved! She was delited that it came out so pretty. They do flat whipped cream with chocolate plaid like lines on top. Plus, it was really yummy! Big hit.   I ordered the butternut squash hash. Whatever they put on that squash was so addictive. This was one of the best things I have had in a long time. Everything in it was delicious.   My little one ordered the mini chocolate chip pancakes. She was full from the hot chocolate (ha!) so I ate half of her pancakes. They seriously need to put these on the adult menu, because they were awesome. I would come back just for these.   My husband got the CK house burger. It was gone in about 30 seconds. He said it was delicious as well. He also got a side of garlic french fries. Yum!  We also got my daughter a cake pop to go!  Its a little pricey, but that's to be expected for good quality food. Overall, 5 stars for sure!!
I go here every Sunday bottomless Mamosa's veggie toast grits caprese omelette, the entire menu has a twist that you will not expect that is super good.

This place is AMAZING! When you walk in the decor is so cute. You can't help but notice how clean and nice everything is and the way it's all set up is so cute. I came in with my two girlfriends and my kids on a Sunday and waited 30 minutes to be sat, but it was so worth the wait. We all ordered something different and all loved what we got. I couldn't find their kids menu online or here so I'm going to post it on here when I'm done writing this. Anyway the food is DELICIOUS! Sooooo yummy! Taking my hubby in next week to check it out again . Love this new spot down the street from my house. Oh! And and Ashley is amazing! She is so sweet, helpful, friendly and kind. She definitely represents the company well! The hostess Mo was fantastic too! Super friendly and sweet as well. I'm big on customer service when I go out and they got a 10/10 on my list! Hahah! Can't wait to come back and eat here soon!

Good food and reminds me a little of Skinny Fats but not so much the fat option. The service was great and the decor is fresh. This place seems to be popular for lunch and the food was good and priced according. I had the crispy avocado tacos which were pretty good over all. My only request would be more sauce.

This is place horrible ! Do not go here ! The staff especially the manager was beyond rude and snarky !!! They had open tables and when my friend was only asking why the 20 minute wait if tables are open and people are waiting ? They replied it is due to kitchen staffing being unable to serve that many tables ! What ?! Then get more kitchen workers duuuhh! They are in a busy area ! The manager decided to come over to me and my friend and tell her " bitchy  snarky nice " they are doing the best the can but the wait and open tables was due to kitchen issues and then went on to say how my friends husband was not welcome there ! He wasn't even with us?! My friend and her husband frequent this place on weekend brunch bc they live close by and the food was good and staffing but recently the staffing had gotten worse and good workers were leaving . When my friend asked why are bringing that up the manger states " just so you know for next time ! What ?????? I was absolutely appalled and flabbergasted by the rudeness of their manager ! That how you treat customers ! Forget NEVER GOING THERE and neither should you !!! They think their sh* t don't stink !!!! SO RUDE! I will Make sure to let everyone I know about this !

Initially when I came here before I was not all that impressed with the service or the speed of the food.  Today the service was much better - not sure if its because I sat inside this time.  And it seemed like the timing for the food was much faster. Also I thought the portion sizes were much better for the foods we ordered today as compared to last time.  Definitely left happy and full today and will come back soon!

Great local place that has amazing food and service. There is a standard menu and seasonal offerings. All the food is so delicious that I have something different every time, except for the strawberry pop tart. I love the chicken and waffles, breakfast burrito and sandwiches. The coffee is also spectacular. It's great to support local businesses and have a wonderful meal/experience.

Overall: no cronuts on weekdays, very cold inside, flakey pastries  We were initially drawn to this place because we saw the cronuts on instagram! So we headed over just for a few pastries for a light breakfast.   To our disappointment, they only sell cronuts sometimes, and mostly on weekends- so they didn't have them! We ended up ordering a cinnamon roll, homemade poptart, and cronut holes.  These were all delicious. The waitress heated them up for us too. The poptart was not too sweet and had an apricot filling, and the pastry dough was very flakey. The cinnamon roll had a little too much icing but was very soft inside, and the cronut holes were so flakey and soft, which made us think of how good the cronut would have been!  One thing to note was that it was COLD inside! I know vegas often over air conditions, but I had goosebumps and plenty of people were getting asked to move outside to get out of the cold.

This place is wonderful.  My brother lives in the area and could not stop talking about CRAFT.  While we were visiting, we went... TWICE.    Friendly service, great food.  Not too much loaded down on your plate.  The pastries are amazing.  When we go back, we will definatly come back.

Great place for lunch or brunch!  Food with Personality all the way.  Homemade soup is delicious,   Cuban Sandwich is amazing.  The Korean Shrimp Tacos were exceptional.  My personal favorite is the Short Rib Hash is was wonderful, just be careful everyone wanted to taste it so there wasn't much left. The have a great private dinning room that is perfect for a small shower or birthday luncheon.  Make a reservation they are busy and don't forget to take some bakery items home they are bAked right there

I truly wanted to absolutely love this place. I had heard so many good things + the basic instagram b*tch in me was dying for the aesthetic pictures!   okay let's get started: my boyfriend and I went in on Thursday afternoon at 12. It looked pretty busy but we got seated instantly so I didn't think service would be a problem. Our server brought us some water and took our order at around 12:05 (no problem). We ordered a simple sandwich and an omelet. At the same time we ordered our food a couple next to us had just ordered as well...   next -- did not see our server for about another TWENTY MINUTES. I thought ok their busy I understand. We still kept waiting for our food unable to order anything else from our server as she hadn't even looked at us since she took the order. 12:34 comes along ..... still no food. However the table in front of us who also had an omelet had received their food, and asked for the check all while we were waiting for our food. At this point I was pretty irate. But just as I was about to say something at 12:40 our food arrived. THIRTY FIVE MINUTES AFTER ORDERING.   Tried to stay optimistic and was thinking the food was going to be amazing. 1st problem- Even after I had asked for my omelet to be well done it was not. I thought whatever it took this long I'm not going to say anything. 2nd problem - the omelet was disgusting. I don't know ho you can ever mess up an omelet but I was so disgusted that I took 2 bites out of my $15 omelet (I added avocado) and left it there.  Now I've only seen my server twice during these 45 minutes and both times were within the first 5 minutes -- she comes back for the third time does not say anything about the food and instead gives us a look like "is it ok" but doesn't say anything!!!!!! No apology for the food or if she could get us anything else :-) .... at this point I'm livid.   I don't know what took longer, trying to even get her attention or our food.   Go here if you want to pay for overpriced bland food and wait 30+ minutes for it. Literally a waste.

I came here for breakfast a few weeks ago and yelp didn't let me down! The service was fantastic, the almond milk latte was on point and the omelet was delicious. We bought some cookies to take with us as well from their pastry counter and they were so good!!  This will definitely be a regular brunch spot for me!
This was the first time eating here, I ordered the Salmon Benny & it was delicious! Defiantly a place to try.
Amazing food. I loved everything. Avocado toast. Açaí bowl. Truffle fries, Mimosas. I loved it all!

High quality brunch place in the Anthem area.  A tad overpriced, but everything I had here is delicious, filling, and beautifully presented.  Finally, tried the Sunday mimosa "deal." Unlimited for $16 with orange, blood orange, and pomegranate. Blood orange was the clear winner.  The servings all small. Disappointed that the refill service was lacking.    There is something here for every palate. Can't decide whether to do a healthier/light meal, heavy, or sweet?  Make sure you go with friends that share. Friends that sample each other's plates are the best.  Last brunch, we had the avocado toast (huge debacle over who go more of the poached egg..j/k), chorizo skillet, chicken and waffles, salmon benedict, and quiche of the day with a side salad.  Our previous brunch, we had the red velvet pancakes, smoked salmon, and short rib hash.    Would order again: both salmon dishes, and short rib hash.  *Side note: bomb potatoes from the skillet  Let's not forget their enticing dessert case.  Ordered a few things here and there over the years.  Unfortunately, some forgettable.  They do offer pre-orders for some of their baked goods/breads for the holidays.  Interior is spacious, gorgeous natural light (for optimal food photo taking), and cute succulents adorned on tables.    *Extras: Private room for events/meetings *Changing table in the restroom for the bebes!

First time I was impressed...today, second time,  I'm a forever fan. Jaret truly knows the essence of who he is and the impact he wants to make with his patrons. He is a master of his craft and picks his staff as carefully as he picks the organic fare he nourishes us with. Being a designer, you are transported to a fresh look that embraces our desert with cacti on the walls and sayings that speak of family and food. Today we were lucky enough to have Katie wait on us and Devin with the good hair, entertain us...great place-great people-great food. Can't wait for next time!!

I was in town visiting family and wanted to try a local breakfast spot. The eggs Benedict caught my eye; I'm not a ham girl, so I asked to substitute for bacon, which was thick, not greasy, and incredibly tasty. The entire dish was amazing! Their homemade citrus hollandaise  was sooooo good!

Real world food.  Story time:  as a grinder, I spend 3 - 4 months a year in Vegas.  Friends from the City call me a local.  Lke a local, I quickly tire of the Strip, the facade, the fakery, the mistreatment of workers at the hands of inebriated "adults" on their first trip to "Disneyland".  Sometimes you gotta get away.  Enter CRAFTkitchen.  A casual SoCal eatery (you know, micro greens, avocados, side salads).  From the second you walk in, the air perfumed with wonderful aromas, fresh brewing coffee, friendly faces.  The food, vibrant and fresh.  From the Early Hours menu, the braised short rib hash.  Tender braised short rib atop thick cut country fried potato topped with a fried egg and micro greens and dripping in its braising jus.  Break the yolk, mix it up.  Yes.  For something lighter, the smoked salmon.  A fresh toasted bagel with a thin smear of cream cheese, deep fried, crispy capers, beefsteak tomato, shaved onions and a mountain of velvety cold smoked salmon topped by micro beet greens.  Meltingly delicious and the perfect balance of flavors and texture.  From the Mid Hours menu, it's all about the croque monsieur panini.  Thin sliced Niman ranch ham, melted gruyere, creamy bechamel in fresh focacia, crisped in a panini press with a side of mesculine.   Nothing fancy, just good eats.  Finally, do not pass on the pastries.  The basic croissant, near perfect.  Flaky layers of thin, layers around a still moist, "stretch when you pull it" core with a gentle salinity and sweet butter finish.  The sticky bun; just get one, or two, or three.  Large portions.  Reasonable prices.  Very friendly, off Strip service.  Thank you Norm K. for the excellent review that sent me here.  A gem and well worth the drive to Hendertucky.

My wife and I went on a Tuesday morning for our anniversary. My wife got the croissant sammy and velvet pancakes and I got the salmon benny. The food was great and so was the mimosas. Service was adequate. We will be back to visit soon.

Craft Kitchen is a neighborhood cafe and bakery. Committed to all things local and organic and featuring comfort dishes ranging from "Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Short Rib Hash and the Turkey Benny. The bakery also has luscious cakes and mini desserts to sink your teeth into.  I like the stuff they carry on the menu, the Short Rib Hash caught my eye. It's braised short ribs, potatoes, roasted sweet onions and peppers with an egg on top. Simply fabulous, the meat was tender and juicy. Potatoes had a good crisp on them and the egg just held everything together.   The Red Velvet Pancakes was tasteful and pretty, with generous amount of cream cheese spread around. I finished it rather quickly, the portion I think could've been bigger. They have great desserts one in particular is the brownie cookie bar, it's so chewy and chocolaty also it's exquisite with ice cream.    The layout of the place is nice had a delightful and spacious ambiance. I came in around noon it was crowded and I still didn't have to wait to sit down. The staff does a good job providing great service, in particular Vanessa is super friendly it was her suggestion to get the chocolate bar.   Overall, this is a great replacement from the Bread & Butter cafe that used to be there.

After reading so many great reviews I had to try this place. I had the chicken and waffles and a decaf coffee. The flavor of the chicken and waffles was good however I think both should have been more crispy. My biggest issue was the portion size, very small. I was actually hungry 2 hours later. Also, the decaf coffee was more like water. I may come back and try something else but I'm not in a hurry.

Who doesn't love breakfast? Breakfast is my most favorite meal of the day so when I find a place that is original with a tasteful menu then you bet I have to try it!   The place is open and has more of an industrial look to it. The front bar serves a variety of coffees and has a Showcase for their oh-so-pretty pastries and jams. If that doesn't get you excited when you first walk into a breakfast house than I just don't know!!   The item for the morning was their crustless mushroom quiche. When our server (I forgot her name) described it, it sounded amazing. So naturally without reading through the rest of the menu I took the servers recommendation and gave it a try. Let me tell you, I was BEYOND far from disappointed. The buttery, rich, savory, earthy flavors and textures that came with that dish was delicious. It was served with a little salad on the side. I know what your thinking, salad for breakfast? Yes, the salad added that balance of texture and flavor. Almost like a palate cleanser that allowed every bite even more amazing! Seriously I'm in love with my breakfast this morning! And when we found out that they make their jams homemade every morning and have a different flavor every day. We of course had to have a side of toast and jam! The toast wasn't your typical toast, it was toasted baguette and served with their mixed wil berry jam! It was fresh, sweet and nothing short of amazing!!   I'm highly impressed with this place I wish I would have found it sooner!! This is definitely in my top recommendations!!

In a sea of shopping centers, an eatery like CRAFTkitchen is the pure definition of hidden gem. If you happen to be way out there in Henderson and craving a non-diner experience, this is your place!  Though the wait on a Saturday is longer than one might expect in the 'burbs, it's a nice place to enjoy brunch. Family friendly for sure, since old people and kids alike enjoy a midday meal. The queue is truly "first come, first serve" so larger parties could wait longer than most. I'd say stick with groups of four or less if you want to get a table in 30 minutes or less.  Those imbibing in an adult beverage can have a single mimosa, or for a better deal, go bottomless. It's $8 for one drink, $16 for endless refills.   Croque Monsieur panini with truffle fries was exactly what I wanted at noon on a Saturday. Other people in our group tasted the short rib hash (with an egg on top), avocado toast and smoked salmon. Portions were just enough, nothing too gut-busting, nor was I left hungry at the end of the meal.   Henderson keeps getting cooler and cooler, CRAFTkitchen is one reason why.

It's too bad that we will never be returning to Craft Kitchen again. My husband and I have always been a fan of their food but the service has declined with each visit over and over. We have probably visited the restaurant more than 10 times; the food is good, coffee is excellent and it is close to home. We decided to give it another shot since we called and they said there was no wait for 2 people on a Sunday at 130 pm. My assumption is the restaurant was half empty on a Sunday (which most brunch places should have a 30 min wait min) because other patrons, similar to us, are just tired of their noticeably slow service. Since it was so empty inside we were hoping the service wouldn't be as timely as our previous experiences here. Sadly, no. After ordering our coffee, our drinks were delivered and our waiter dashed away without taking our food order. 15 minutes later, after I flagged him down that we were ready, he took our order. We waited.... waited and waited some more. 45 minutes later we were upset to see that food was being delivered to 3 other tables surrounding us that were seated almost 20 minutes after us. Since our waiter did not care to check up on us or inform us that our food was ready, I asked a food busser if she could check on our order.  She returned to tell us that new batter had to be made to make our pancakes. An update from our server would have been nice if there was a long delay from the kitchen.  The food was delivered after another 15 minutes of waiting and low and behold, my husband's order was incomplete.   To our server's defense, he constantly on the move, and overwhelmed with so many tables beyond his control. Maybe this explains his inability to check up on us. The restaurant needs serious modifications in their management structure. I wish this was our only poor experience at Craft Kitchen, but it was not. We love to support local businesses but unfortunately we will never return to this establishment nor recommend it to any of our friends and colleagues again.

Thought we try something away from the strip, so we gave this place a shot. We were not disappointed. Wifey and I split the Chile Relleno chorizo burrito and churro waffles. Both items were bomb.  The Chile Relleno chorizo burrito was delicious. The Chile was not spicy at all, although I prefer spicy, it was still good. The tomatillo green salsa which came with it complimented the burrito well.  The churro waffles were also very tasty, but be warned, they were a bit sweet (at least for me they were, the wifey said they were fine). Covered in a rich creamy caramel sauce these churro waffles were amazing.  The little ones ordered pancakes. One ordered red velvet and the other chocolate chip. I tried them both and they were both pretty good.  We will be retiring here again before we leave Las Vegas.

With warm anticipation, a new breakfast/lunch venue has opened in South Henderson on Eastern near St Rose.  With a fair amount of neighboring competition, it seems as though the aim to differentiate is towards locally sourced, organic ingredients...important to some, if you're into that sort of thing ;)  Starting off with the Croissant Sammy: Thick Applewood Smoked Bacon, Sharp Cheddar & Over-Hard Egg. Excellent sandwich, perfectly crispy bacon on a golden buttery pastry!  This was very enjoyable, fair portioned and memorable.  Pulled Turkey Benny: Charred Tomatoes, Avocado, Poached Egg & Citrus Hollandaise. Nice presentation, could fare well with a bacon bit or added crunch for texture, piled high of turkey, with a creamy avocado.  The underlying citrus is welcomed.  Citrus & Crab: Lump Crab, Avocado Puree, Baby Lettuce, Fingerling Chips & Champagne Vinaigrette. Very good, lettuce-cup-like in presentation with a fair amount of shredded crab and citrus. A bit difficult to eat with a fork, I just ate them like lettuce cups with my hands...hope you guys don't mind, I'm not shy around the dinner table :P  And finishing off with the Sliders: Grilled Onion, Cheese, Greens on a Whole Wheat Bun. Juicy, served medium rare, yet in need of an aioli / mayo to soften the doughy/yeasty wheat breading.  I'm a bit of a burger/slider snob, but it's almost there!  I was told that a lot of the menu is going under final revisions, subject to ingredient tweaks and adjustments.  I think the direction is spot on, and would love to revisit to venture further into the diverse menu selections.  Recommended!

This place is wonderful , especially if you can eat outside if the weather permits. Everything is made with healthier ingredients . The Waitress Tracy ?! Was super on point and very nice.  The Cuban Sandwich is better than what you get in an actual Cuban restaurant around here. They make eggs in detailed and high end ways that make them "special". Some of the desserts are small but they are perfect! The taste is quality all the way. CraftKitchen is a fine restaurant to check out and meet with friends and family. I would give it five stars but some items are pricey. But again better ingredients so it makes sense.  Recommended!

Great atmosphere and delicious food. It's a little overpriced in my opinion though! It's perfect if you want a trendy place to have yummy food and good Instagram pictures, but be prepared to spend at least $15-$20 a person. They do have lots of gluten free and vegetarian options!
First time at Craft Kitchen and it was delicious.  Quick service only negative the chairs are not very comfortable and I'm a small/ medium size person.

Came here for lunch today while I waited for my car to get washed across the street. I had actually been wanting to come here for brunch for quite sometime,but for some reason I always end up at Kitchen Table. I was greeted immediately by a very courteous young man who seated me promptly at the table I requested. A few minutes later an Asian waiter came to take my order. I requested the croque Monsieur be made a croque Madame and I also ordered a side of truffle fries with a small orange juice . All the food was very tasty (with the exception of the bread on the croque I was not a fan) and the oj was very fresh of course. The only reason why I gave this spot three stars and not 4 was because after my waiter took my order, I never saw him again. I had to get up and ask for whatever I needed and at the end of my meal get up and ask for my check. In defense of the staff EVERYONE ELSE other than my waiter was fantastic and very attentive. Perhaps he went on break? Maybe he should've let someone know?

So far I've only had one meal here.  It was pretty good too.  Beef sliders with garlic fries. I'm most impressed with the fact that they have GF bread and desserts, hard to find in this area. I'll definitely go back
Love love this place! Fresh delicious food with a great atmosphere. The service is friendly and efficient. We will be back soon.

The churro waffles are so freaking delicious, the best churros I've ever had! Chilaquiles were good too, I should have asked for it to be spicier. The cafe is very hip and stylish. I wish they had more locations all around Vegas so I can get the churros whenever I want LOL

CRAFTkitchen is so cute and the food is so bomb. I'm always a sucker for cute brunchy vibe places. Their server Jeffery is always super welcoming when I come in. He recommended my now favorite breakfast order which is the chorizo scramble skillet. I tried the croissant sammy today too which was "flaky buttery deliciousness" also we had a fruit plate today and all the melons and berries were perfectly ripe. I've been here and had their bottomless mimosas too which are pretty good. If you're in a drinking mood definitely try the blood orange mimosas!! I didn't care too much for the pomegranate mimosas. Also if you're going on a breakfast or lunch date the booth window seating is super cute. I'm also a fan of all the desert flower art in this place. Check it out! It's a great spot.

the place was impeccably clean and staff was very friendly. The menu selections were creative and tempting. The prices were moderate for a place of this caliber, however the portions a little small for the price and felt as though the location dictated this.the mimosas were good but the plain orange was the favorite ( pomegranate and blood Orange also available) the Michelada was good. Service was very attentive and did not lag even on a busy Sunday morning. Overall good experience.
If you prefer higher end and natural dishes served by an enthusiastic staff then this maybe for you. Lots of healthy natural choices and a staff that stays right on top of things with a smile.

Went in for brunch this morning with a lot of anticipation for something wonderful.  We loved Chris Herrin's Bread and Butter in this same spot.  The decor is very inviting and spacious.  The outside seating looked very nice but we opted to sit inside.  The menu is very eclectic and you can get breakfast or lunch items all day.  The thing is - everything is pretty pricey.  Red velvet pancakes were tasty but not worth the $10.75.  Chocolate milk for the kids was $2.75 for a glass - no refills.  They offer a carafe for $5, but it turns out that a carafe only has one and a quarter glasses of milk.  Not at all worth it - in fact it seems kinda like a ripoff.  The sliders were somewhat greasy and nothing very special.  The chicken and waffles were pretty good.  Service was okay.  We had to wait for a while for our food and the table next to us received their food first even though they sat down and ordered after us.  We had to keep flagging servers down for drink refills and for the check.  One server kept saying weird things.  When bringing some more syrup, she said "that's my workout for the day" and then "just kidding".  The bill for 4 of us including tip was over $80.  I hope they re-evaluate their pricing and work on the service professionalism.  We'd really like to have another nice locals place to eat.

I have visited this new start up 6 or 7 occasions thus far. Most often for breakfast - in part because they serve great coffee. The decor is bright - fresh - clean. Service is excellent and friendly. But the real star here is the food.  Offerings are not your standard bacon and eggs fare. Short rib hash, smashed potatoes, avocado crostini, pastries, caprese sliders are brightly flavored and beautifully presented.  Future adds will be housemade breads for purchase/take home.  Stop in near their 3 pm close and they will sell you left over housemade slider buns and pretzel rolls at a discount. Check this place out!
Very unique menu items. All delicious. Very friendly staff as well. If you're a foodie this place is a lot of fun for you (and your taste buds).

Pretty good, great vibe, some food came out cold and service was mediocre. The style is great, it reminds me of Newport Beach.. Green modern style. My latte was dropped off with no sweetener and had to wave down help.. Also had to ask someone else to bring us waters.  Oatmeal Brûlée was amazing with the sweet shell and they leave a nut assortment on the side that is delicious tossed in the oatmeal . Short Rib hash came out cold and bland for my taste. Dessert (bread pudding) was yummy. I sent my Bloody Mary back, the way they make it taste weird.. Like a virus smokey taste.. She said it was from the bacon but it wasn't the bacon in my opinion. I would order a standard Bloody Mary not theirs.

CRAFT Kitchen's Salmon Benny is carefully prepared and truly delicious. Fresh-squeezed orange juice & fresh fruit plate = tasty, refreshing additions. Coffee is brewed 1 cup at a time, and the refill came without asking. CRAFT Kitchen gets it right!

Got to love fancy smancy brunch. Menu is limited, but they hit the spot when it came to satisfying my breakfast needs. I def recommend anyone to come. I do warn people to come early though because they can get a line. Either way, great breakfast spot.

Cute breakfast pastry spot at the edge of Henderson.  A group of us girls decided to host a holiday brunch here with the theme being "an ugly sweater and white elephant party exchange". Craft Kitchen has a private room for a large group that is enclosed in glass which also has a closing glass door. You are seated away from the other guests; however  you can look through the glass room  and they too can look back into the Glass Room . Which makes the rooms semi-private.  A number of my friends ordered their bottomless mimosas which they really enjoyed during our visit. I ordered the chicken and waffles which was really good and spicy. The waffle was very flaky and the chicken was fried nicely.  The chicken and waffles came with a pickled jalapeno and pickled jalapeno maple syrup. The syrup had a hint of spice and heat with a taste of sweet as well. While there we didn't have the opportunity to try their pastry from their pastry bar, however another one of the guests did order a tray of pastries that she would take to a party later that night. Overall Craft Kitchen is a place that I would tell people to try especially for breakfast and I would like to go back and try it one more time without a group of people.
Thank you Jeffrey for going above and beyond for our big family! Bottomless mimosas, family, and good food definitely defines a happy Sunday! We will be back for more happy Sunday's. :)
Super friendly staff, very attentive and polite! Food is fantastic, haven't had a bad meal yet!

With Hockey season finally winding down and a brief lull in his family's busy schedule it was Saturday morning that Chef Blinn had a few minutes to step away from the stove to say hello, week 129 of the Weekly Brunch Menu in full swing and not a single seat open at CRAFTkitchen in Henderson.  Always a personal favorite and showing no signs of slowing, the service if anything more well-polished than ever despite a jammed pack interior and patio also crowded despite climbing Summer temperatures, it was seated in a coveted window booth that two guests quickly saw Coffee filled and kept that way for two hours, a collection of new items coursed out slowly in addition to one surprisingly never tasted across over a dozen meals.  Still something of a unicorn in terms of concept, nearly everything including Bread made on-site and quality seasonal Produce forming the backbone of a menu people will go out of their way for even though no shortage of Breakfast spots exist in the 702, it was with four all-new Pastries that the morning got underway, Chefs Blinn and Ryan-Small once again outperforming most nationally-famous Bakeries regardless of dietary preferences with the PopTart and Gluten Free Peach Muffin both noteworthy and a Croissant-Muffin hybrid packed by super-sweet Blueberries in Lemon Cream all standouts.   Always happy to partake in Jaret's city-best Monkey Bread, a sharable portion soaked in molten Frosting that itself justifies an hour-long round trip from home, it was taking a break from sweeter things that weekly special Biscuits and Gravy were presented in thick Pork Sausage Gravy, the stick-to-your-ribs classic featuring a 2x8 inch fluffy base tinged in Rosemary and White Cheddar as good as any in town with a choice of two Eggs in any style on top.  Staying savory for another round, house English Muffins served beneath housemade Carnitas in lightly heated Salsa just one of CRAFTkitchen's many delicious Bennies, it was on the recommendation of a local encountered at work that the CK House Burger was tasted next, that man's assertion of "best Burger in the city" potentially accurate thanks to a fluffy Potato Bun that holds up to a meaty grind topped in buttery Cheese which balances nicely against Tomato-Onion Jam and crisp strips of Bacon.  Returning to #everchangingbrunch specials to finish, the fact that Stone Fruits with Cheese had shocked many seemingly educated co-workers not so long ago still a surprise as CRAFTkitchen presented their own delicious combination of Peaches and Burrata atop seasonal Greens with vibrant Vinaigrette, it was perhaps even more surprising that Chef Blinn managed to surpass previously high expectations with a plate of French Toast sandwiching Cheesecake Filling between slices of Texas Toast, the interior turning to Custard-consistency on a new flat-top and all the better with sliced Peaches tossed in Vanilla Sugar...though not quite good enough to forgo a slice of Carrot Cake or previously untasted Brownies and Macarons.  FIVE STARS:  Still setting a high bar by paring skill, sourcing and service CRAFTkitchen remains a true "destination" Breakfast in a city where such a thing never existed prior and even those waiting half-an-hour for a table should consider themselves lucky to do so because even in New York or Chicago this place would still stand-out and likely lead to lines much longer.

....really nice location...I had the C.K. Special and it was good...I didnt realize till later no one asked if I wanted more coffee...perhaps they serve by the cup but if that is the case they should have a French Press as an option...surprised their baked products were so limited...and as a whole there just seemed something a tad off with how they present themselves and execution....perhaps they were training new employees....I will go back for sure...

Great service, great food. I was treated here for a birthday brunch and my best friend and I chose Craft Kitchen because neither of us have been here before.   I ordered the smoked salmon and my best friend ordered the short rib hash, and bottomless mimosas (classic and pomegranate). Everything was great! The smoked salmon was on top their house made pretzel buns (2 in total); portion and flavor was great. It wasn't a hearty meal (which is what I was going for). The short rib hash, on the other hand, WAS hearty, but oh so delicious. I actually wished I ordered that instead lol. All in all, great place. Definitely coming back for more.

Went into craft to pick up a few goodies.  Ended up with a massive cinnamon roll, strawberry macaroon and some cronut holes.  And none of them disappointed.  The cinnamon roll was the size of my face.  Seriously this thing was massive.  But my goodness it was so light and airy.  So damn delicious.  But not a fan of the frosting.  Sorry craft.   Macaroons were delicious with real sliced strawberry in the middle.  Definitely cut down on the sweetness.  But my minis fave is the Cronut holes.  Have to admit there cronut holes beat out anyone else in henderson.
Food is always consistently amazing but the service...ugh. The service needs so much work.

We just tried the Cuban and the French dip with truffle fries and it was AMAZING! This place is legit! Awesome service, super clean, accommodating for our stroller and baby carrier, and quality ingredient! Can't wait to go back for the breakfast!!

Excellent food. I had the crab & citrus salad. My plate could of been bigger. The portion was perfect but the lettuce leaves were huge and i could barely cut it without it falling all over the table. Coffee was great. I would definitely go back and try more items.

Had a great experience her. I've seen a lot of people checking in here, and have been dying to go. The last few times we tried to go here, there was a line at the door, and unfortunately we had no time to wait.   Pros: Healthy breakfast options Beautiful pastry's Service Food Quality Atmosphere Strong/flavorful organic coffee  Cons: The only ones I can think of is sometimes you may have to wait. Also, although my food was perfect, one person in our party was a little picky, and their eggs were under cooked.  Overall:  If you are looking for an interesting, healthy, quick breakfast or lunch, then stop in here to enjoy it in a homey, but modern atmosphere!

My wife and I didn't enjoy the food here, unfortunately. It's a cute little place and has nice service but my wife's short rib hash didn't have much flavor, tasted mostly like bland gravy. I got 2 eggs, bacon and potatoes. That's a pretty simple dish and it was done well but I'm extremely confused why a breakfast place wouldn't have toast. I've had the chorizo burrito before as well and it was barely ok. I've never had chorizo that was so dry and flavorless.
Great vegan menu! Cute interior friendly staff, little pricey but you get your money's worth as a whole package when dinning here.

The food here is unique and delicious. The brunch is great, though usually crowded... the Friday night dinners are a better time to check this place out... the food and beverage pairing dinners for two are great for a date night! Don't miss the smoked wings!
Delicious items, a little pricier than other places as sides are not included but great variety, fresh bales goods, even espresso which is not that easy to find, and organic ingredients

The food is high quality!  While the portions are small to average, the flavor, presentation, and quality can't be beat.  The service is always very good or excellent.  My roomie treated to me to breakfast, and a treat it was!

Yummy yummy yummy! I don't know why it took me this long to review this restaurant, especially since I've been back a countless number of times. I try to order something new each time I go. So far, my favorites have been the short rib hash and avocado toasts. Their mochas and cappuccinos are delicious as well! The thing I love the most about the food is that it tastes super fresh and not overly seasoned or cooked in oil. I leave feeling satisfied and guilt free. They're all you can drink mimosas on the weekends is also worth trying! Just expect a fairly long wait during brunch. But busy means the food must be good right? :)
Absolutely delightful and diverse menu! Excellent coffee and dessert! I only wish I lived here and that I could enjoy eating here more often!

I was really excited about the opening of CRAFTkitchen! I am definitely a fan of the cute, modern decor/seating and the beautiful presentation of the food (very instagram-able!).  But unfortunately, I'm not a fan of the small portions and the high price of the dishes.  My friends and I ordered the Short Rib Hash, Beef Sliders, Truffle Fries, and Sweet Potato fries w/ Maple Bacon Aioli.   - Short Rib Hash: I actually wasn't totally in love with this dish as much as other yelpers were! There was a bit too much gravy for my liking. I really liked the tenderness of the braised short ribs though! The smashed potatoes that it came with were good as well but nothing that stands out. I also added a poached egg for $1.75.  - Grass Fed Beef Sliders: I actually preferred the Sliders over the Short Rib Hash!! The plate came with 3 sliders which had pecorino cheese, arugula pesto aioli, carmelized onion on a house-made potato roll. It was delicious!! The only complaint was that my friend ask for his sliders to be cooked medium rare but it seems like that request was ignored unfortunately since the server told us that they were "cooked medium/medium rare anyway". When the dishes came out, the waitress didn't know the cook of it and his sliders ended up being cooked medium instead, much to his disappointment ):   - Fries: The truffle fries were pretty good but I would say the Sweet Potato Fries definitely stands out more with the Maple Bacon Aioli sauce!! The fries + that aioli sauce were probably one of favorite things to eat.   Would I come back to CRAFTkitchen again? It's unlikely. The food was tasty but my friends weren't even full after eating their entrees and sides, despite paying a hefty bill for brunch (~$20-25 each).

Just came here for brunch and had an fantastic experience. Short rib hash; Chorizo skillet; Monkey bread were all delicious. Erica our waitress was great and front manager Derek was exceptional. Excellent food and service. Highly recommend this place!

Looking for a place to Sunday Brunch!? CRAFTkitchen is where it's at, even though the wait is worth it. 10am is prime time before the rush of brunchers on Sundays. I've been here twice, once was with my family and they loved everything they ordered.   We ordered Salmon Benny, Veg omelette  Avocado toast & Berry pancakes. Every single item was amazing & indulgent, even though some of their serving sizes isn't as big, it makes you content by the end of your meal!   Second time I was here I went with a few friends. The wait was 45 mins, but we decided to stick it out since we were already there. We ended up only waiting about 20-30 since we think people decided to drop their spots. It was definitely brunch hour around 1245. My friend and I decided to order the seasonal crab cakes because we were stuck with avocado toast and the egg, but wanted more protein. It was the best thing I've tried at CRAFTkitchen and so amazed by the concoction of flavors, it was a party in my mouth. Haha   Definitely will be a returning customer bringing brunchers to table!

A friend of mine recommended this place as she knows the owners. I haven't had time to check it out yet, but I wanted to grab my parents a gift card. While here this morning, I decided to get a few baked treats. Oh my goodness... The kouign amann is amazing. I had never heard of this delectable treat before! The lightness of a croissant inside with a crisp outside. So good! Perfect amount of sweetness. I got a few other sweets as well, but haven't tried them yet. Service was friendly and quick for my small bakery order. Will be coming back soon with my friend for an actual sit-down meal! But I'm still getting the kouign amann!

So I've been here twice with larger parties and both times my food has been phenomenal. Including their brunch and bakery. I detracted one star though for the extremely slow service. Especially during brunchtime and with bottomless drinks, it didn't feel bottomless.   I highly recommend their brunch specials. Additionally, the chicken and waffles, short rib hash, desserts (homemade pop tarts especially), and the farmers stack lunch entree were very well loved each time I went.

First time trying it. The food was delicious!!! The waitress was great and we got lucky enough not to encounter any wait time ... the waitress recommended the monkey bread , although we were full , we took it to go and were not disappointed!!  Loved the ambiance and the nice seating nooks by the window. Would definitely come back!

Living in Sunridge at MacDonald Ranch is pretty sweet, but with the addition of the Craft Kitchen at Eastern and Sunrdige Heights, the experience just got even better.  What an amazing little slice of culinary heaven tucked away in the best kept secret in Henderson.  We just finished our second visit after a nice mid-morning walk...gotta justify the bottomless mimosas (traditional, pomegranate and blood orange) somehow!  The menu is truly amazing, with flavorful customization to traditional dishes, like the pulled turkey benny or completely unique dishes like their short rib hash, which left me licking the plate, the cutlery and anything the plate and cutlery touched...almost got me tossed, but I think they had seen the reaction before! The restaurant its self is very charming, you will immediately forget that this funky-fresh, country-cool eatery is situated in a strip mall...they created this fun little outdoor eating area where seating is at a premium, that is separated from the rest of the world by a sort of make shift herb garden created from customizing old pallets... The food is great and well it should be as the owners are very accomplished chefs on the Strip and this little venture, from what I understand is where they get free reign to express all their creativity, and wow does it show!   The staff for the most part is wonderful, especially a young go-getter named Caleb, who is definitely destined for great things!  Jeffrey, who has helped us twice is also extremely helpful and accommodating, we sat inside today after our walk and my wife was a bit chilled, so asked to be moved outside.  Jeffrey and Caleb made sure we were moved to warmer climes and well situated outside, but unfortunately, this seemed to rub the person in charge of the great outdoors the wrong way.  I believe her name was Katy, hard to know, as she was determined to either ignore us completely or to get us to leave as quickly as possible...which is the only reason I am unable to give the Craft Kitchen a 5 star review at this time.  I wasn't sure if she was upset because she had interlopers in her area whose tip would be going to another server, or if she was angry because one of her tables would be taken up by us for a few minutes...we were nearly done with our meal, Caleb moved our dishes to the outside when we reseated and reminded Katy that we needed a couple more mimosas.  Maybe she didn't like being reminded of this from a younger member of the staff, but for whatever reason, she conveniently forgot and we were left waiting for about 10 minutes before I went back inside to see if I could just bring the drink order out myself and was told that it would be brought to me.  Katy (again, I hope I'm getting her name correct) finally delivered our drinks and asked, "who was your server"?  I mentioned that Jeffrey was helping us and she left. Half way through the second glass of our "bottomless mimosas" Jeffrey showed up and gave us our bill.  Apparently Katy told him we were ready to leave...again, she couldn't wait to get us out of her station.  Normally I get a bit prickly about something like that, but we still had to walk home and while one more mimosa would have made the mile home a bit more enjoyable, I might have wandered into traffic or stumbled into a random wall, so I guess I should thank her for making sure we go out of there before we could do too much damage to ourselves or the oncoming traffic!   Still it would have been a much nicer experience for us if she had recognized the fact that had she gotten us the drinks quickly, we would have finished more quickly instead of waiting for our drinks.  Also, had she just "taken one for the team" and provided the exemplary service we received from the other members of the staff there might have been an effort put forth on our part to ensure she received a separate tip for herself.  Instead, she made it quite clear that she really didn't have the comfort level of the guests at Craft Kitchen as her top priority; just those that she was sure would enrich her tip jar at the end of the day. At any rate, the Craft Kitchen is easily one of the best places for breakfast/brunch/lunch in 89052, and is well worth the drive from any other zip code for that matter!

My wife suggested this place so we decided to go. Happy wife happy life.  The place has a nice feel to it and every employee that we talked to was helpful and kind. I like the way the restaurant was decorated. Little things like the centerpiece on the table just added to feel.  Everything everyone ordered was delicious. With great food and great service how can you go wrong? You can't! So sit back, relax and enjoy something from the bakery or order something from the menu and enjoy.

This place is a lot cuter in real life! As soon as you come up - you see some pallets turned into planters which gives the place a bright entrance. As soon as you walk in, you'll see the counter along with  a display of their desserts. There are a few booth seats along the window, along with a separate room that you can see into through glass. They also have these cute little square salt & pepper shakers along with a mini plant on each table.  My friend and I got the Smoked Salmon, Red Velvet Pancakes, and the Sweet Potato Fries. Everything came out pretty quickly and looked amazing! All the dishes were very colorful. The prices can be a bit high for the portions, but that's just my opinion.   Smoked salmon: comes with two little pretzel buns, some sort of sauce, a decent amount of salmon, some micro-greens and some little green things that I had no idea what they were. Something in there was really salty so it wasn't as enjoyable. I believe it was those little green things that made it pretty salty.  Red velvet cakes: comes with 4 little red velvet cakes, cream cheese icing, white chocolate (?) shavings, and some raspberries & blueberries (like 4 of each...). These tasted exactly how they should but they were a bit dry, so I wasn't able to finish all of them sadly.  Sweet potato fries: skinny sweet potato fries and a side of crack sauce (maple bacon aioli). Tasted how you would expect them to! Some of the skinnier fries were a bit burnt though.  The servers were really nice and pleasant. I can't remember their names because there were about 3 who helped us out. They always checked up on us and tried to have little conversations with you. I would consider this place a hidden gem! This place is a bit of a drive but I would consider coming back.

Always a hit!! They cater to any allergy needs, the food is impeccable and the atmosphere is chic! Craft is my go to for casual, well executed food. The staff is relaxed but attentive. They never make you feel rushed. Fav brunch spot!

I've been here a few times. Ordered crab eggs Benedict and it was fine. Their tart but delicious Hollaindaise came on the side.   Coffee was out of a machine.   The pastries are pretty amazing though! Tons of options from cinnamon rolls to apple tarts and small individual sized pies.   Service was friendly and prompt.

Some of the best food I've had in Las Vegas. So if u come to Vegas u have to come here. The Mimosas  and Mocha were the best we have had it a long time. Service and cleanliness were much appreciated. We will be back!

Bad staffing! Wanted to have breakfast today, 12 people waiting, said it was a 20 minute wait for 2 and there were 5 cleaned tables for 4 and one booth area for 4 and one for 2 open. I asked if he was sure it is 20 min as there were SO many tables clean and ready to go not to mention a fully open outdoor seating area.  It's Sunday am!! If you don't want to be fully open, you will eventually go out of business like everyone else who starts slacking.

Stopped by for a late breakfast/early lunch.  Delicious Salmon Benedict and fresh coffee.   Would have been perfect if the waitress had EVER checked in with me after depositing my food.   Had to ask someone else for a coffee refill and that still didn't spur her to come by.

The best brunch place with the best service from everyone especially Katie!! Everything is always delicious & on pint. Love the salmon benny & breakfast burrito! Bottomless mimosas are the best too. Definitely a weekly spot for the best food!!

Great food, iffy service. Service started out great and got progressively worse. I think the wait queue was getting too long and no one wanted to sit outside because it was too cold to sit outside, that made the staff want to rush us out. We wanted to get a few things to go, but the servers wouldn't even wait for us to finish speaking before rushing off. In the end, it left a bitter taste to an otherwise great brunch. I would have given then 3 stars, but I want to give them benefit of the doubt.

Went for brunch yesterday with my siblings. The server got my brother's order slightly wrong by bringing sausage instead of bacon . Shortly after my sister took a bite from her farmer's stack and found a long hair that was weaved through her food . As for me, I had the Turkey Benny. The meat was dry, the Hollandaise sauce was oddly sweet, and there was quite a bit of avocado sauce on there (making it overwhelming) .   Don't get me wrong, I get it ....hair happens but not when you have a restaurant.  The manager was kind  and took care of us after that but we were just over it at that point .

LOVE this place!! My boyfriend just had breakfast here! We split a chicken and waffle and short rib hash! EVERYTHING was phenomenal! Food was clean, not greasy at all, presentation was beautiful, service was amazing- from the hostess, to the wait staff! New favorite place!!

Probably won't eat here for a while... Fined at this restaurant numerous times & it has always been spectacular.We ordered an assortment of food to brunch w/ a friend in town from LA.   FOOD: My shrimp Po'Boy was missing the shrimp when it arrived at the table. The remoulade was slathered all over the bun that my fingers were coated w/ sauce. Churro waffles & Roast Beef sandwiches are amazing though.  SERVICE: I would say our server was adequate at best. Waited awhile to get our food order in. When she checked on us at the end of the meal, She cleared my half eaten plate & we asked for a box. She came back & dropped the check WHEN we still wanted to order some delicious pastries to-go.  Being someone that has worked in the F&B industry and dined at this establishment many times, I left pretty disappointed.

I have been here just for coffee and most recently for breakfast.  I had the chorizo scramble and it was good but the chunks of chorizo are much too large.  The service and ambiance is nice so overall an A-OK rating until I try some other menu items...pastries look decadent.

Decor was beautiful. Menu had variety. Server was nice and gave us a pastry when we mentioned it was our first visit.  My carnitas omelet was cold in the center- and the side of toast was dry and cold, not to mention tiny. Should have been included in cost of breakfast. The coffee was almost $3 for a cup, which felt unreasonable for portion size and quality.   All in all way over priced for what was offered, and the quality of the food didn't live up to the decor.
Amazing food! Me and my little man enjoyed a lunch date of GF kids cheeseburger sliders and short rib hash. So good!

One of my most go to brunch spot. Craft kitchen not only have an amazing staff, they have a scrumptious menu! I love being able to sit outside in the spring with my little yorkie. They're pet friendly and are always welcoming. There is a private room for special occasions and work meetings as well.
